item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Primary Education for Children

Let's Educate for a Better Future

Providing education to the poor is an essential step towards reducing poverty and inequality in society. It gives disadvantaged individuals a chance to break the cycle of poverty and build a better future for themselves and their families. Donate Now Read More

Medical and Health Services

Let's Strive for Better Health for all

Access to healthcare should not be a privilege reserved for the wealthy, but a basic human right for all. By providing medical services to the poor, we can ensure that everyone has the opportunity to receive the care they need, regardless of their financial situation. Donate Now Read More

Women Empowerment

Let's Build a Better Tomorrow for Women

Help develop skills that can be a powerful tool for economic empowerment, allowing women to become more self-sufficient and financially independent. Donate Now Read More

Child & Family Welfare

Let's Build a Better Society

Efforts towards family welfare are important to ensure that families lead a healthy, fulfilling life and contribute to the progress and development of society. Donate Now Read More

Our Esteemed Donors

Get Involved

Let's Make a Difference Today

Become a Volunteer

Help us reach out and fulfill our goals to promote social equality through various outreach programs that we are running 

Click here

Donate to a Cause

You can donate to us to help educate a child, get the underprivileged the medical attention they need, empower women or improve the overall living condition of a family

Click here

Get to Know Us

Learn more about the different projects that we are running since 1968. 

Click here 0 + Volunteers 0 Projects 0 Centres 0 Sponsors

About Us

Our Work Promise to Uphold the Trust Placed

Seva Sangh Samiti stands for Spirit, Service, Association and lastly and organistaion. The caption "Committee of Mutual Help" as the phrase referes to the formation of a committee by Rev. Father Francoise Laborde, who with the help of local people of the slum started an organisation to improve the living conditions of the locality.
  • Primary Healthcare
  • Primary Education
  • Women Empowerment
  • Family Welfare
0 Years of Experience Read More Reports & Data

Recent Campaigns

Donate to Help for a Cause

View All Campaigns

Primary Education

Project Aim

Providing education to the lesser privileged section of the society is an essential step towards reducing poverty and inequality in society. It gives disadvantaged individuals a chance to break the cycle of poverty and build a better future for themselves and their families. Donate Now Program Details

Medical Services

Project Aim

Access to healthcare should not be a privilege reserved for the wealthy, but a basic human right for all. By providing medical services to the poor, we can ensure that everyone has the opportunity to receive the care they need, regardless of their financial situation . Donate Now Program Details

Women Empowerment

Project Aim

To help develop skills in women for becoming economically productive to gain employment or start their own businesses so that they can contribute to the economic development of the family and as a result the society gets economically developed as a whole. Donate Now Program Details

Child & Family Welfare

Project Aim

Child & Family welfare refers to proper nurturing and upbringing of children and to provide improvement of the overall health of a family through rations, help to pursue education and family counselling. Donate Now Program Details

Get to Know Us

Fundraising for the People and Causes You Care About

Seva Sangh Samiti stands for Spirit, Service, Association and lastly and organistaion. The caption "Committee of Mutual Help" as the phrase referes to the formation of a committee by Rev. Father Francoise Laborde, who with the help of local people of the slum started an organisation to improve the living conditions of the locality.

Play a short Video on what we do

Who we are and what we stand for

item.title: Who we are and what we stand for
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
In the year 1968, Seva Sangh Samiti was registered under the West Bengal Society Registration Act, Regn. No. s/8870(a) of the 1967-68. The Samiti was lead by Mr. Dennis Maher, President and Miss Veronica Florian as the first treasurer with a Secretary Mr. L. Louis and other members.

Seva Sangh Samiti stands for Spirit, Service, Association and lastly an organisation. The caption "Committee of Mutual Help" as the phrase suggest refers to the formation of a committee by Rev. Father Francoise Laborde, who with the help of local people of the slum, put his service to improve their living conditions. Pilkhana is one of the largest slums of Calcutta with over 100,000 inhabitants. They lack proper nutrition, sanitation, employment and healthcare. Father Francoise Laborde lived amongst the poor people in a small rental room to look into their problems.

The main objectives of the committee are to look into the following:

  1. Health affairs of the slum people.
  2. Education for all children living in the slum.
  3. Living condition of the poor people by supplying clean water and sanitation.
  4. Relief and rural development since growth of urban slums is rooted in rural poverty.

item.title: Campaigns List
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
campaign-list

Primary Education

Project Aim

Providing free education to the lesser privileged section of the society is an essential step towards reducing poverty and inequality in society. It gives disadvantaged individuals a chance to break the cycle of poverty and build a better future for themselves and their families. Donate Now Program Details

Medical Services

Project Aim

Access to free healthcare should not be a privilege reserved for the wealthy, but a basic human right for all. By providing medical services to the poor, we can ensure that everyone has the opportunity to receive the care they need, regardless of their financial situation . Donate Now Program Details

Women Empowerment

Project Aim

To help develop skills in women for becoming economically productive to gain employment or start their own businesses so that they can contribute to the economic development of the family and as a result the society gets economically developed as a whole. Donate Now Program Details

Child & Family Welfare

Project Aim

Child & Family welfare refers to proper nurturing and upbringing of children and to provide improvement of the overall health of a family through rations, help to pursue education and family counselling. Donate Now Program Details 0 + volunteer 0 sponsers 0 branches 0 + Years of Experience

get involved

We are Working for a better future

get involved now

item.title: Primary Education
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Campaign detail

Primary Education

Access to quality education is a basic human right, and every child deserves the opportunity to learn and grow, regardless of their background. In West Bengal, many underprivileged children face significant barriers to access primary education including poverty, discrimination and social marginalization. As a society, we have a responsibility to address these challenges and create a more equitable and just education system. One potential solution is through partnerships between non-governmental organizations, corporate sector and philanthropists. By working together, these groups can pool their resources and expertise to create high-quality educational programs that are accessible to all. For example, NGOs could help to identify and enroll children who are most in need, design educational programs in tune with the State's education policy and effectively administer such programs through their volunteers and mentors while the corporate sector and the well-meaning people of the society can provide with the financial help to run such programs smoothly, creating a more inclusive and supportive learning environment for all children. Here comes the role of local volunteers to serve as teachers and mentors for underprivileged children. By tapping into the expertise and knowledge of community members, we can create a more personalized and culturally responsive learning environment that meets the unique needs of each child. This approach not only helps to improve educational outcomes, but also promotes community engagement and empowerment, creating a sense of ownership and investment in the education system. In addition to community-based approaches, we can also leverage technology to expand access to education. For example, online platforms and virtual classrooms can provide remote learning opportunities for underprivileged children who may not be able to attend traditional schools. By partnering with local organizations and community leaders to provide access to technology and resources, we can create a more flexible and adaptable education system that meets the needs of all children. Ultimately, ensuring access to free primary education for underprivileged children in West Bengal requires a multi-faceted approach that involves a wide range of stakeholders. By working together, we can create a more equitable and just education system that promotes social mobility, reduces poverty and empowers the next generation of leaders and innovators. Previous Next

our main goals

Here are some primary goals in providing free primary education for the underprivileged in West Bengal:
  • Increase access to Education
  • Improve Educational Outcomes
  • Ultimately reduce poverty and inequality
  • Promote Social Justice
  • Empower Communities

Primary School at Banipur

Project Aim

Providing free education to the lesser privileged section of the society is an essential step towards reducing poverty and inequality in society. We have a running primary education curriculum at Banipur, Sankrail, which looks after the primary education needs of the locality

Primary School at Jhorkhali

Project Aim

Providing free education to the lesser privileged section of the society is an essential step towards reducing poverty and inequality in society. Our flood centre at Jhorkhali, Sunderban, West Bengal, doubles up as our Primary Education Centre in the area, providing a chance for the underprivileged to accomplish their dreams.

Access to quality education is a basic human right, and every child deserves the opportunity to learn and grow, regardless of their background. In West Bengal, many underprivileged children face significant barriers to access primary education including poverty, discrimination and social marginalization. As a society, we have a responsibility to address these challenges and create a more equitable and just education system.<\/p>

One potential solution is through partnerships between non-governmental organizations, corporate sector and philanthropists. By working together, these groups can pool their resources and expertise to create high-quality educational programs that are accessible to all. For example, NGOs could help to identify and enroll children who are most in need, design educational programs in tune with the State's education policy and effectively administer such programs through their volunteers and mentors while the corporate sector and the well-meaning people of the society can provide with the financial help to run such programs smoothly, creating a more inclusive and supportive learning environment for all children.<\/p>

Here comes the role of local volunteers to serve as teachers and mentors for underprivileged children. By tapping into the expertise and knowledge of community members, we can create a more personalized and culturally responsive learning environment that meets the unique needs of each child. This approach not only helps to improve educational outcomes, but also promotes community engagement and empowerment, creating a sense of ownership and investment in the education system.<\/p>

In addition to community-based approaches, we can also leverage technology to expand access to education. For example, online platforms and virtual classrooms can provide remote learning opportunities for underprivileged children who may not be able to attend traditional schools. By partnering with local organizations and community leaders to provide access to technology and resources, we can create a more flexible and adaptable education system that meets the needs of all children.<\/p>

Ultimately, ensuring access to free primary education for underprivileged children in West Bengal requires a multi-faceted approach that involves a wide range of stakeholders. By working together, we can create a more equitable and just education system that promotes social mobility, reduces poverty and empowers the next generation of leaders and innovators.<\/p>","align":"left","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Poppins","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":15,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"400","_margin":{"unit":"px","top":"15","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"drop_cap_view":"stacked","drop_cap_primary_color":"#F8FAFF","drop_cap_secondary_color":"#25283A","drop_cap_border_radius":{"unit":"%","size":5,"sizes":[]},"drop_cap_typography_typography":"custom","drop_cap_typography_font_family":"Poppins","drop_cap_typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":40,"sizes":[]},"drop_cap_typography_font_weight":"700","__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=ab7d014"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"},{"id":"238e7d69","elType":"widget","settings":{"carousel":[{"id":643,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/WhatsApp-Image-2023-01-10-at-16.56.55.jpg"},{"id":642,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/WhatsApp-Image-2023-01-10-at-16.56.52.jpg"},{"id":641,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/WhatsApp-Image-2023-01-10-at-16.56.51.jpg"},{"id":640,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/WhatsApp-Image-2023-01-10-at-16.56.49.jpg"},{"id":639,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/DSC_0547-scaled.jpg"},{"id":637,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/DSC_0536-scaled.jpg"},{"id":636,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/DSC_0531-scaled.jpg"},{"id":634,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/DSC_0522-scaled.jpg"},{"id":633,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/DSC_0549-scaled.jpg"},{"id":567,"url":"http:\/\/www.sevasanghsamiti.org\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/02\/teach.jpg"}],"thumbnail_size":"medium_large","slides_to_show":"2","slides_to_show_tablet":"2","dots_size":{ item.title: Medical Services
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Campaign detail

Medical Services

The organization offers free medical check-ups to individuals in eight different departments, including gynecology, pediatrics, dental, ophthalmology, general medicine, dermatology, ENT and Chest Medicine. Each department is headed by a qualified doctor who offers consultation services to individuals who require it. The organization ensures that all the necessary medical equipment and supplies are available to the doctors to provide quality medical services. The free check-up facility ensures that people can receive medical treatment without worrying about the costs. Apart from the departments mentioned above, we have a fully equipped physiotherapy center manner by a trained Physiotherapist, who provides services to the patients as prescribed by the doctors.

The free pharmacy is an important service offered by the organization. After the consultation, the patients can collect their prescribed medication from the pharmacy without paying any fees. The pharmacy is well stocked with medicines and supplements, ensuring that all individuals can receive the necessary medication to get rid of their maladies. The NGO also ensures that the medicines are stored in proper conditions, maintaining their efficacy and quality.

The organization also provides spectacles and dentures as prescribed by our specialists mostly free of cost or at a subsidized rate for those who are above poverty line. This service is particularly beneficial for individuals from lower-income families who cannot afford expensive eyeglasses or dentures. All the above facilities are available at our Medical Centre at Pilkhana, Howrah, while at our Banipur Centre, we have a primary health care dispensary manned by a doctor, where free medical checkup and consultations are provided to the local community as also free medicines are supplied to them as prescribed. However, we are not in a position to expand the facilities in Banipur for want of funds. But we intend to expand our medical activities at Banipur since adequate space is available there for such expansion.

In conclusion, the free medical services provided by the organization are an essential service for individuals who cannot afford quality healthcare. The organization's services include free doctor check-ups in eight departments, a free pharmacy, physiotherapy, free or subsidized cost of making spectacles and dentures. These services improve the health and well-being of individuals and contribute to the development of the community. The NGO's efforts in providing these services play a vital role in improving the lives of many individuals in the localities.

Previous Next

our main goals

The primary aim of our Healthcare project are as follows:

  • Free Medical Checkup
  • Free access to Medicines
  • Access to high quality spectacles and dentures at subsidized rates

Medical Centre at Pilkhana

Project Aim

We provide free medical checkup along with free pharmacy at our Medical Centre situated in Pilkhana, Howrah, West Bengal.
We also provide spectacles and dentures at a highly subsidized rate to the individuals who require it.
We have doctors for the departments of General Medicine, Pediatrics, Dental, ENT, Dermatology, Genecology, Chest Medicine and Physiotherapy.

Medical Dispensary at Banipur

Project Aim

We have a free dispensary service at our Banipur Centre in Sankrail, Howrah. We provide general doctor checkup services along with free medicine to the people of the community if the rural areas surrounding Sankrail.

item.title: Women Empowerment
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Campaign detail

Women Empowerment through Skill Development

Women Empowerment is an integral part for a comprehensive economic development of the society as a whole and specifically for the poorer sections of the society. Such objective can be achieved through the following:  

  1. Self-Confidence through Skill Development: The belief that "I CAN" is the biggest tool for an individual for becoming economically productive. Such self-confidence can be brought about through skill development that can help them gain employment, start their own businesses.  These skills can be a powerful tool for economic empowerment, allowing women to become more self-sufficient and financially independent.

  2. Self-Expression through creativity: Inherent natural creativity of a person can be brought out through designing and creation of small articles of personal use. Manufacturing apparels, knitting, making of junk jwellery and soft toys, hand printing and painting of garments, etc. can be various forms of creative self-expression, which can be an important tool for women who may not have many opportunities to express themselves in other ways. By creating various articles of their own, women can showcase their individuality and creativity.

  3. Skill Development & Environmental Sustainability: Skill Development programs can also promote environmental sustainability by encouraging the use of secondhand materials and by promoting the use of upcycling and repurposing techniques.

Presently we are running a free tailoring curriculum (cutting and sewing of garments) at our Banipur Centre for such skill development providing the women from the local communities with valuable skills, social support and a sense of purpose and self-expression.

Previous Next

our main goals

To help in creating a section of women in the society who are able to become self-dependent through their skills and add economic values to their families and to the society.

  • Economic Independence of Women
  • Skill Development of Women
  • Increase confidence of Women in their own abilities
  • Self-Expression through skills

item.title: Family Welfare
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Campaign detail

Child & Family Welfare Programme

Child & Family welfare programs are crucial for the well-being of children and families in underprivileged sections of society. Our organization focuses on child & family welfare and is running a baby care and creche facility at Pilkhana Medical Centre for underprivileged parents, both of whom are daily wage earners. We have another program for kids above 5 years to support their education and bear all expenses for their education viz. books, educational materials, stationery, school tuition fee, etc. The support system enables children from underprivileged families to receive an education and have the opportunity to improve their future prospects. We also have a  monthly ration distribution program to support the underprivileged families in need.

Baby Care Centre is a specialized facility that provides essential care and support for infants and toddlers aged between 0-2 years. Our centre offers a wide range of services, including nutrition, medical care, physiotherapy, and early childhood education. The aim is to provide a nurturing and safe environment for young children to grow and develop. It is a great resource for parents who need help caring for their young children, especially when they are daily wage earners and lack the capability of taking proper care of their children.

Creche services for 2-5 year olds provide essential care, nutrition, education, and playtime for young children. These services are designed to meet the unique needs of children in this age group, who are in a crucial stage of their development and require a nurturing environment to thrive. Nutrition is also a key component, with healthy meals and snacks served to support the child's growth and development. Education is also an essential part of creche services, with trained professionals offering age-appropriate learning activities and experiences to promote early childhood development. This includes early literacy and numeracy skills, as well as social and emotional learning.

The monthly ration distribution program is a significant aspect of the organization's family welfare program. The organization provides essential food items, including rice, wheat, pulses and cooking oil to families every month. The ration distribution ensures that families have access to basic food items and can fulfill their nutritional requirements. The program is especially beneficial for families who struggle to make ends meet and cannot afford to purchase food items regularly.

The child & family welfare programs introduced by the organization have had a significant impact and ripple effect on the community. Children who receive an education can contribute to the community's development and progress. The program has also helped reduce the burden on families who would have struggled to provide for their children's education and basic food requirements. . 

Previous Next

our main goals

We aspire to achieve the following:

  • To prevent malnutrition and promote healthy growth of children
  • To Promote Socialization amongst children
  • To Promote proper nurturing of children
  • To Empower caregivers of the family
  • To provide family counseling for proper upbringing of children

Baby Care Centre at Pilkhana

Baby Care Centre is a specialized facility that provides essential care and support for infants and toddlers aged between 0-2 years. Our centre offers a wide range of services, including nutrition, medical care, physiotherapy, and early childhood education. The aim is to provide a nurturing and safe environment for young children to grow and develop. It is a great resource for parents who need help caring for their young children, especially when they are daily wage earners and lack the capability of taking proper care of their children.

Creche Services at Pilkhana

Creche services for 2-5 year olds provide essential care, nutrition, education, and playtime for young children. These services are designed to meet the unique needs of children in this age group, who are in a crucial stage of their development and require a nurturing environment to thrive. Nutrition is also a key component, with healthy meals and snacks served to support the child's growth and development.

Education is also an essential part of creche services, with trained professionals offering age-appropriate learning activities and experiences to promote early childhood development. This includes early literacy and numeracy skills, as well as social and emotional learning.

These services are designed to meet the unique needs of children in this age group, who are in a crucial stage of their development and require a nurturing environment to thrive. Nutrition is also a key component, with healthy meals and snacks served to support the child's growth and development.\n

Education is also an essential part of creche services, with trained professionals offering age-appropriate learning activities and experiences to promote early childhood development. This includes early literacy and numeracy skills, as well as social and emotional learning. item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
About us

We Work for the upliftment of the underprivileged and promoting social equality

In the year 1966, Rev. Father Francoise Laborde, a French priest, along with a group of few locals from the localities of Pilkhana in Howrah decided to join together in an endeavor to improve the living conditions and help their fellow men. They formed a committee which would meet thrice a week and be called "permanent committee" for listening to the needs and requirements of the people who lived in Pilkhana.

Our Goals

Societal Upliftment

Educate Children

Empower Women

Health Services

Proper Nutrition

help is our main goal!

Seva Sangh Samiti stands for Spirit, Service, Association and lastly an organistaion. The caption "Committee of Mutual Help" as the phrase referes to the formation of a committee by Rev. Father Francoise Laborde, who with the help of local people of the slum started an organisation to improve the living conditions of the locality.

This committee started meeting regularly and receiving lots of appeal from the slum's inhabitants, and help was given in a small way. Thus the beginning was indeed very small but an encouraging effort.

In the year 1968, Seva Sangh Samiti was registered under the the West Bengal Societies Registration Act, 1961 bearing Regn No. s/8870(a) of 1967-68. The Samiti was lead by Mr. Dennis Maher, President and Miss Veronica Florian as the first Treasurer along with Secretary Mr. L. Louis and other members.

Seva Sangh Samiti has always tried to enhance the self-esteem of the local inhabitants. It also strives to underline the real values these people cherish in their day to day life - friendship, courage, hospitality, family bonding and fighting the worst. 

The main objectives of the Samiti are to look into the following:

  1. Primary Health Care for the marginalized section of the society.
  2. Education for all children below the poverty line.
  3. Upliftment of Living Conditions of poor people through family welfare program.
  4. To empower women for inclusion in the economic ecosystem of the society.

A Glimpse of our Golden Past

Report published in the souvenir brought out on the occassion of golden Jubilee celebration

get involved

We are Running Projects to Promote Primary Education, Social Welfare, Empower Women and Improve Healthcare for the poor

get involved now

item.title: Contact Us
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
contact us

Contact us

feel free to contact & reach us!

To know more about feel free to drop in at our Head Office or give a call to our President or you can drop in an email too, we will definitely get back to you.

Head office address:

12, Watkins Lane, Howrah, West Bengal, Pin - 711101

Contact Number:

Arpan Das: +91 9331077284 (Executive Officer)

item.title: Blogs and Insights
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Blogs & Insights

Who we are and what we stand for

Organisation History In the year 1968, Seva Sangh Samiti was registered under the West Bengal Society Registration Act, Regn. No. s/8870(a) of the 1967-68. The Samiti was lead by Mr. Dennis Maher, President and Miss Veronica Florian as the first treasurer with a Secretary Mr. L. Louis and other members. Seva Sangh… Read More

join our newsletter to follow closely all news and updates

Thanks for subscribed!

item.title: Transparency Facts
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Transparency Facts

Being Transparent Helps Build Trust

Reports & Data

Read all about the work that we have been doing. Our reports are for all to see. Building trust is an essential step in helping others. We want you to know about us and put your faith in us after understanding about us.

Reports & Facts

Financials & Balances

Read all about the work that we have been doing. Our reports are for all to see. Building trust is an essential step in helping others. We want you to know about us and put your faith in us after understanding about us.

Financials 0 + volunteer 0 sponsers 0 branches 0 Projects

get involved

We are looking for help to be able to help the ones in need

get involved now
